instruction: Can the FDR spectral data be considered as a superior method for spectral data preprocessing in the optimal forecasting model for leaf nitrogen accumulation (LNA) in winter wheat using hyperspectral remote sensing?
Output: Yes, the FDR spectral data can be considered as a superior method for spectral data preprocessing in the optimal forecasting model for leaf nitrogen accumulation (LNA) in winter wheat using hyperspectral remote sensing. The study found that the FDR spectral data had the best comprehensive performance compared to other preprocessing methods. It was also stated that the characteristic bands of FDR were mainly distributed in the visible light and red edge regions, and these effective bands were consistent under different field conditions. Additionally, the FDR-PLSR-SVM model using the effective wavelengths of FDR exhibited excellent performance for LNA prediction. Therefore, based on the results of the study, the FDR spectral data can be considered as a superior method for spectral data preprocessing in the optimal forecasting model for LNA in winter wheat using hyperspectral remote sensing.
